bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with yan mei 魘寐 . Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 5: 鬼氣、邪魘、屍厥、暴亡不省 人事等疾，至聖太一散方 , “For ailments such as demon qi, evil nightmares , corpse[-like condition because of qi] recession, sudden loss of consciousness with an inability to recognize people, resort to the recipe for the ’ powder to reach sagehood and great unity ’”. Xie yu 邪郁 , pent-up evil [qi] [1]

Etiological Agent. identical with BCGM 郁①, yu pent-up [qi]. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry shui yin fen 水銀粉： 水銀乃至陰毒物，因火煅丹砂而出，加以鹽、礬煉而為輕粉，加以硫黃 升而為銀硃，輕飛靈變，化純陰為燥烈。其性走而不守，善劫痰涎，消 積滯。故水腫風痰、濕熱毒瘡被劫，涎從齒齦而出，邪郁為之暫開，而 疾因之亦愈 , “ Shui yin is a poisonous substance of extreme yin-quality. It is produced by means of a fire refinement process from cinnabar, another refinement with salt and fan creating qing fen , then sublimation with liu huang to generate yin zhu , then another modification by means of sublimation to create a pure yin-substance of extreme ferocity. Its nature is to move; it cannot be guarded. It is good in removing phlegm and saliva, and in dissolving accumulations of sluggish [qi]. Hence when it removes water swelling and wind phlegm, moisture heat and poison sores, if saliva emerges from the gums and pent-up evil [qi] is given a temporary opening there, then the cause of the ailment is cured too”.
